body: Hi. `brew config` / `brew doctor` would have told you that building from source is not supported. We recommend installing to /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew, where you should not have that issue. Sorry

That’s where homebrew installs by default on Fedora Silverblue.

Aral

On Sat, Feb 4, 2023, at 4:17 PM, Michka Popoff wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi. `brew config` / `brew doctor` would have told you that building from source is not supported. We recommend installing to /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew, where you should not have that issue. Sorry
> 
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/issues/14557>, or unsubscribe <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAAKGRVELHDUXRXUPMUTNKLWVZXJLANCNFSM6AAAAAAURG26FI>.
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID: ***@***.***>
>

I don't know much about Fedora Silverblue.
Is `/var/home/` as symlink to `/home`?
Is there something special with `/home` on that os?

The fix might need to be done in https://github.com/Homebrew/install, to get Homebrew to install itself at the right place.

The symlink design (https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/fedora-silverblue/technical-information/#filesystem-layout) probably doesn't play well with `brew` itself. Issue should be moved to that repo.

`brew` resolves symlinks when defining variables like https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/blob/master/bin/brew#L52-L54
```bash
BREW_FILE_DIRECTORY="$(quiet_cd "${0%/*}/" && pwd -P)"
HOMEBREW_BREW_FILE="${BREW_FILE_DIRECTORY%/}/${0##*/}"
HOMEBREW_PREFIX="${HOMEBREW_BREW_FILE%/*/*}"
```
@aral again can we see your `brew config` and `brew doctor` please?
FYI I was able to reproduce this. I'll dig a little bit more to see if I can find a solution.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs.

Yes, just found a solution in https://github.com/Homebrew/discussions/discussions/1282

Look at https://github.com/Homebrew/discussions/discussions/1282#discussioncomment-4766216 and https://github.com/Homebrew/discussions/discussions/1282#discussioncomment-5067527

Not sure if we should try to implement that workaround (if possible); or leave it up to our users.
Closing as there is a workaround

> Not sure if we should try to implement that workaround (if possible); or leave it up to our users.

I guess we can _suggest_ it. Actually implementing it would require editing `/etc/fstab` to make the bind mounts permanent, and that's quite invasive, even if the installer already has the necessary `sudo` permissions.
